unit: Unit 7 | Inference for Quantitative Data: Means
title: Confidence Level and $2$-sided Significance Testing
question_text:
A one sample $t$-test for was used to conduct a test of the null hypotheses:
$${ H }_{ 0 }:\mu =23.7$$ $${ H }_{ a }:\mu \neq 23.7$$
The $p$-value was $0.034$. A confidence interval for *$\mu$ * is to be constructed.
Of the following, which is the largest level of confidence for which the confidence interval will NOT contain $23.7$?
solution:
Since we do not want the confidence interval to contain $23.7$, this indicates that we want to reject the null hypotheses.

For each one of the confidence levels, create the significance level that corresponds to the confidence level. Then, see if you would reject or fail to reject the null hypotheses using the $p$-value and significance level.

For a $90\%$ confidence level, the significance level is $10\%$. $0.034 < 0.10$; therefore, we reject the null hypotheses.

For a $95\%$ confidence level, the significance level is $5\%$. $0.034 < 0.05$; therefore, we reject the null hypotheses.

For a $96\%$ confidence level, the significance level is $4\%$. $0.034 < 0.04$; therefore, we reject the null hypotheses.

For a $97\%$ confidence level, the significance level is $3\%$. $0.034 > 0.03$; therefore, we fail to reject the null hypotheses.

For a $99\%$ confidence level, the significance level is $1\%$. $0.034> 0.01$; therefore, we fail to reject the null hypotheses.

The largest confidence interval that will not contain $23.7$ is $96\%$. Choice 'C' is correct.
